alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 11:20AM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. .The Maple River at Maple Rapids and Grand River at Comstock Park continue to rise slowly after the snowmelt and rainfall last week. Additional rainfall tonight through Tuesday will cause additional rises through mid-week, and will keep these points above flood stage through the rest of this week. For the Grand River...including Comstock Park...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Monday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 01/02/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
